Please Don't Make Me Install Linux

A guide for the reluctant, the confused, and the mildly terrified.

Look, I get it. You've heard Linux is amazing but the thought of installation makes you want to hide under your desk. Maybe someone told you to "just use the terminal" and now you're questioning your life choices. I've been there, and that's exactly why this site exists.

I'm documenting everything I wish someone had told me about Atomic Linux distributions (sometimes called immutable distributions) – the good, the bad, and the "why is my screen suddenly filled with error messages??" This is Linux without the gatekeeping, the jargon, or the assumption that you enjoy pain.

Who's This For?

  • Accidental Linux Users — Did your IT department force Fedora Silverblue on you? We'll help you survive.
  • The Linux-Curious — Heard that atomic distros are more stable and secure? Let's explore without the stress.
  • Tech-Savvy Explorers — Want to understand the benefits of atomic updates without wading through forums? We've got you.
  • Future-Focused Users — As traditional distros evolve toward immutability, get ahead of the curve in a friendly way.

Whether you're using Fedora Silverblue, Kinoite, openSUSE MicroOS, or any other atomic distro, this site aims to make your experience less painful and more productive. And maybe, just maybe, you'll even start to enjoy it. (No promises though.)
